title: 2 Fast Ways to Export Your Thunderbird Email & Profile

steps.title: Create a folder on your computer for your exported messages.
steps.content: Create a folder on your computer for your exported messages. If you want to export one or more email messages from Thunderbird, you can save them to a new folder as EML files. EML files are easy to import into most other desktop email apps (including Outlook and Apple Mail) by simply dragging and dropping them into a folder in the email app. Whether you're on a Windows PC or Mac , right-click (or control-click) the desktop, select New Folder , enter a name for the folder, and press Enter or Return . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select the messages you want to export.
steps.content: Select the messages you want to export. Click a folder in the left panel, then highlight the messages you want to export. To select all messages in the folder, click one of the messages, then press Ctrl + A (PC) or Cmd + A (Mac) to select all . To select multiple messages (but not all messages), hold down Ctrl (PC) or Command (Mac) as you click each message.

steps.title: Right-click (or control-click) the selection and choose Save as.
steps.content: Right-click (or control-click) the selection and choose Save as . This opens your computer's file browser.

steps.title: Select the new folder click Select Folder or Choose.
steps.content: Select the new folder click Select Folder or Choose . This exports the selected Thunderbird messages to the folder. You can now repeat these steps to export mail from other folders.

steps.title: Click the hamburger menu and select Tools.
steps.content: Click the hamburger menu and select Tools . The hamburger menu is the three horizontal lines at the top-right corner of Thunderbird . Use this method to export all your Thunderbird mail, address book(s), calendars, and settings to a ZIP file. [2] X Research source This is a great option if your goal is to back up Thunderbird. If you're backing up the files, you may want to connect a flash drive or external hard drive to your computer now.

steps.title: Select Export.
steps.content: Select Export . This opens Thunderbird's profile export tool in a separate tab. [3] X Research source The Export tool will only work if your Thunderbird emails and other information are less than 2 GB. If the folder is larger than 2GB and you're unable to export it: [4] X Research source Click Open profile folder on the Export screen. Select everything in the folder by pressing Ctrl + A (PC) or Command + A (Mac). Press Ctrl + C (PC) or Cmd + C (Mac) to copy the entire selection. Open the folder you want to save the files to. You can create a new one by right-clicking or control-clicking the desktop (or another location) and selecting New Folder . Press Ctrl + V (PC) or Cmd + V (Mac) to paste the copied files.

steps.title: Click the Export button.
steps.content: Click the Export button. This opens your PC or Mac's file browser.

steps.title: Select a folder and click Save.
steps.content: Select a folder and click Save . This exports all mail and other Thunderbird data to the selected folder. If you want to import the exported profile back into Thunderbird (either on the same computer or a different one), click the hamburger menu and go to Tools > Import .
